poojatanna9: Mumbai ! Carter road is a must , the buzz on that street is amazing, especially at night. There is a coffee shop called ccd and you can grab a coffee whilst taking in the vybe and watching the sunset. Post that you can head next door to Corniche where they serve up lush food, awsome cocktails and wicked music. Marine drive known as tge queens necklace is beautiful to stroll along at night with lots of juice bars and places to grab the yum bombay sandwich from! Olive is a cool n sassy place to eat in bandra. Out if the blue is a lush place to eat - it's a chain but really good food! Farmers cafe which is kind of new sells organic fresh food and it's meant to be yum! Ayre is a club that many go to and the roof top bar is meant to be wow! Yaucha is another top place to eat at BKC ( bandra kurla complex ). Elco market for the famous pani puri which is in juhu / bandra. Head to the flea market round bandra it's got an eclectic mix of lil stalls! Lots of lovely shops round there too! Golden gate Elephanta caves. Hop on a train to Churchgate station and head to colaba - another cool place with lots of markets want lots of British architecture from when the Brits ruled. Santa cruz west , juhu, colaba are good places to shop for Indian attire, Fusion attire shops, boutiques and high end branded names. Hope you enjoy your Indian trip hun x

rebelranis: We’re here visiting Hyd right now! Come every year. For food gotta go to @cafebaharhyd, @jewelofnizam, Absolute Barbecue, Chutneys (for that straight South Indian), Golden Dragon (for the Indo-Chinese goodness). For bars/lounges - @fatpigeonbarhop (beautiful rooftop with live music), @prostbrewpubhyd, @farzicafe, Over the Moon (great rooftop as well!). If you wanna take any pics while you’re here def check out Falaknuma Palace as a setting (it’s stunning 😍). For shopping check out @storeanonym, @anahitahyderabad, @elaheofficial, @plantationhouseindia. And so much more! Let us know if you’re looking for anything specific!You’re gonna have the best time 😊
srikala.a: Anywhere in East Godavari (Kakinada, Vizag, Rajahmundry, etc.) has AMAZING food. DO NOT HOLD BACK! Also, since you’ll be so close, you should really consider visiting villages or the backwaters in the Konaseema area! My dad is from Rajahmundry and I hold anything to do with near there so close to my heart! I always make it a point to go when I visit. HAVE THE BEST OF TIMES DEEPS.

ashamoosai: Mumbai and Delhi are beautiful! I would add Agra and Jaipur, definitely visit the Taj Mahal, the Amer fort in Jaipur, Jaipur has fantastic roadside shopping! Cute little markets. If you go to Delhi make sure you go to old Delhi as well to see what it’s really like. Hyderabad I’ve never been to but my dad has been several times and apparently it’s wonderfully ahead in technology, and visit Golkonda fort! Also extend your trip that’s too short lol @deepica
rainbowscraps: It’s gonna be foggy in Delhi that time! Watch put for plane delays. I would definitely go to Chandni Chowk if you make it there though. Love the shopping and food!
sindhuchandraa: Trips to India never go as planned! Everyone demands your time and it's hard to say no. My advice is don't plan too much, and don't beat yourself when u can't follow the plan. Happens to everyone! Just enjoy meeting people and try to soak in as much as u can 😊 if you want to take a mini vacay with your dad in the south and not travel too far, I'd suggest Kerala. Have fun 😊

hanifarahman5: Qutubshahi Tombs, Golconda Fort, Chowmahallah Palace (You can dress up with royal clothes and pose and take vintage pictures like princesses/queens), Falaknuma Palace (Dinner), Charminar, Lad Bazar (Fun stuff like jewelry/bangles etc as gifts)... Shadab Hotel for authentic hyderabadi dishes like kebabs/curries etc, Hyderabadi Biryani either from Shah Ghouse or Paradise.... Make sure you vlog and post on youtube if you can!! Omg, my mouth is watering right now!! Miss Hyderabad so much! ❤️ It's been 4 years since I've last visited! 😭
